message:
Technology General Championship 2017-18 | Chem Quest

The results are as follows:

Gold - Patel
Silver - Nehru
Bronze - RK

Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winners!

Greetings from Technology Students' Gymkhana!

The Smart India Hackathon (SIH) was a national level effort connecting the higher education campuses. The SIH was primarily a code-fest in which software programmers were challenged to write programmes giving innovative solutions to more than 500 problem statements. The SIH-2017 elicited an enthusiastic response with more than 40,000 students participating. It was concluded in the first week of April 2017 with Hon’ble PM addressing the participants. This is being followed with Smart India Hackathon-2018 which was formally launched details of which can be found in https://innovate.mygov.in/sih2018/.

The MHRD now proposes to expand the scope of SIH-2018 by including hardware section in it. This platform will provide an opportunity to the innovative minds to showcase their solutions at the national level. It is also proposed that the best entries at the national level would also be provided funding through the Research Parks and the Technology Business Incubators (TBIs) for product development for their eventual commercialisation/extensive social use.

The MHRD expects a good participation in this Hackathon from all the IITs and NITs.
All students are requested to provide ideas (with or without models/prototypes) that will be proposed as problem statements of the Smart India Hackathon 2018. This should be done by mailing the idea totech.gymkhana@gmail.com by 13th November, 2 AM.

You are also requested to go through the 400+ problem statements provided in the aforementioned link and register for the Hackathon. The problem statements are both software and hardware based.

AFTER THE HUGE SUCCESS OF NAVARACHANAA 2016
We are back to have the same technical blast as we had done in the 2016.
So here we introduce the National level project competition
*NAVARACHANAA-2017* from* 30th March, 2017* to *31st March, 2017 *with
themes,
1) Digital India 
2) Make in India
3) Skill India/ Startup India
4) Smart city
5) Swachh Bharat Abhiyan
6)General Category
We are glade to invite you for this phenomenal opportunity to showcase your
ideas and Implementation as a cherishing outcome in the contribution to the
Nation's Dream.
For further Details:-
navarachanaa@svvv.edu.in

CV Shortlisting

5th Inter IIT Tech Meet

Note: Deadline has been extended till 24th Feb, 8 pm

CV Shortlisting

5th Inter IIT Tech Meet

Note: Deadline has been extended till 24th Feb, 8 pm

We have started accepting CVs for the events of 5th Inter IIT Tech Meet.

The criteria for CV shortlisting will be based on:
1. Relevant skills
2. Past Experience in Relevant field
3. Achievements in Relevant field
Make sure you prepare your CV accordingly. The CV should not be more than 1 page.

 The CVs along with all the proving certificates/documents are to be mailed to interiittechmeet.kgp@gmail.com with the Subject "*Event Name* - CV Shortlisting". Any e-mails with any other subject won't be considered. All the files and scanned copies should 
be strictly in pdf format.

Deadline for submission: 22/02/17 8 pm

**Note: There will be a different selection criteria for Messier Marathon. It will be revealed later.

Hello KGP!

5th Inter IIT Tech Meet has finally been confirmed and is being held at IIT Kanpur from 24th - 26th March, 2017. A doc for the brief description of events is attached below. 

Refer the doc for knowing your interests and start preparing for the same. The Problem Statements and other details along with the contingent selection criteria will be released soon.

Refer the doc for knowing your interests and start preparing for the same. The Problem Statements and other details along with the contingent selection criteria will be released soon.

story: Technology, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Transfer Group , IIT Kharagpur's photo.
message: Technology, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Transfer Group , IIT Kharagpur's photo. In continuation of the ongoing Patent Drive, efforts are being made to protect the inventions by the students and researchers. We would like to identify and protect the technologies to be displayed in the upcoming Techno-management festival Kshitij™. In this regard all the institute participants of Kshitij events especially (i) Eureka, (ii) Embetronics, (iii) Droid Blitz, (iv) Conquest, (v) Arm Of Achelous, (vi) Sandrover, (vii) B.R.I.C.K.S, (viii) Kryotech, (ix) Anadigix and (x) Initiative Prakriti are requested to send an abstract along with required drawings of their invention to submissions@ktj.in. "The deadline for the institute participants has been exclusively extended up to the 12th of Jan " The patentable inventions will be recommended for filing after scrutiny by the expert techno-legal committee. Please be assured that Institute will provide all necessary support to protect your valuable inventions. Please note that all your valuable inventions need to be protected by filing the patent before disclosing to the public. This is an excellent opportunity to protect and look for the possible marketability and commercial viability of your inventions. Such protection prevents the unauthorized use of your invention and provides a meaningful exclusionary right to the patent holder. The details of Kshitij events can be found in the following link: http://ktj.in/#ktj/Events

story: Technology, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur's post.
message: Technology, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur's post. SRISTI celebrates the creativity and innovation of young technological students by recognising their outstanding projects with Gandhian Young Technological Innovation (GYTI) Awards. These awards are given every year during the Festival of Innovation (FOIN) at Rashtrapati Bhawan in the month of March. Next year, these awards are due tentatively on March 5, 2017 at FOIN. It is hoped that such recognition will enthuse young innovators to pursue even more outstanding research addressing unmet social needs and set up entrepreneurial ventures in consonance with Start-Up movement gaining strength currently in India. Any student project that has been completed during 2014-15 to 2016-17 is eligible for consideration of awards.The students need to submit the projects at following URL: www.gyti.techpedia.in. Financial support is also given to some of the awardees as per numerous windows of opportunity: Last date for submission of entries is November 30, 2016 You can email your queries to gyti.techpedia@sristi.org ,or call at 9099258492.

Technology Students' Gymkhana congratulates the awards recipients!

Gymkhana awards 2015 - 2016

Application for the gymkhana awards in the genre of technology are invited for 

1) Prof. G S Sanyal Cup.
2) Order of merit.
3) Hon'ble mention.
4) Ashoke Mukherjee Cup (Outgoing student who has made outstanding voluntary contribution to the Gymkhana)

CVs should be mailed to gymkhana.kharagpur@gmail.com by 11/04/2016 at 6pm. All the relevant documents (supporting points mentioned in the CV) should be mailed along with the CV.

In the resumes following information can be included:

*Participation in the GC.
*Position of responsibilities.
*Participation in tech events (eg. KTJ, out station participation).
*Inter IIT Tech achievements. 
*Meaningful projects and technical papers.
*National/International conferences.

Regards

story: Technology, IIT Kharagpur added 6 new photos — with Vedasheersh Boorla and Somesh Kumar.
message:
Interactive session with Prof. John Mather witnessed an overwhelming response from students and faculty members alike.

We are sincerely thankful to Prof. Somesh Kumar to make the event successful.

story: Technology, IIT Kharagpur added 6 new photos — with Vedasheersh Boorla and Somesh Kumar.
message:
Interactive session with Prof. John Mather witnessed an overwhelming response from students and faculty members alike.

We are sincerely thankful to Prof. Somesh Kumar to make the event successful.

A senior astrophysicist at NASA, Prof. Mather is the recipient of 2006 Nobel prize in Physics. He is a senior project scientist at JSWT, which will be successor to Hubble Space Telescope. He was part of the COBE satellite, which confirmed the Big Bang theory. He was listed twice by TIME magazine; among 100 most influential people in the world in 2007 and then again in 2012 among 25 most influential people in space.

Strengthen the foundation of your thoughts through his precious words.

Date: 29th February (Monday), 6:30 PM
Venue: CET Studio 1, First Floor, Takshashila

A senior astrophysicist at NASA, Prof. Mather is the recipient of 2006 Nobel prize in Physics. He is a senior project scientist at JSWT, which will be successor to Hubble Space Telescope. He was part of the COBE satellite, which confirmed the Big Bang theory. He was listed twice by TIME magazine; among 100 most influential people in the world in 2007 and then again in 2012 among 25 most influential people in space.

Strengthen the foundation of your thoughts through his precious words.

Date: 29th February (Monday), 6:30 PM
Venue: CET Studio 1, First Floor, Takshashila

A PAN IIT interactive session with Prof. Herald Haas has been arranged on 14th February at 6:30PM. Prof. Haas holds the Chair of Mobile Communications at the University of Edinburgh. He is acclaimed to be the inventor of Light Fidelity (Li-Fi) which was listed among the 50 best inventions in TIME Magazine 2011.

Link for webcast is http://nknvcreplay.nic.in/replay/webcastShow.html?key=vUUIZ1dDHHitrBr

Link will be live from Sunday (14th Feb.) 6:30 PM onward. Venue for online interaction is NKN Virtual Classroom, JCB Lab Complex.

Note: The event will consist of a keynote speech from 6:30 PM - 8:00 PM. Q&A session will be from 8:15 PM.
